message.content:
ANALYSIS OF MAIN TARGET IMAGE

1) Overall Block Count and Layering  
• The model uses a total of 8 blocks:  
   – 4 orange cylinders for the legs (all the same shape and orientation).  
   – 2 yellow rectangular prisms laid flat, side‐by‐side, to form the “seat.”  
   – 1 orange cylinder standing vertically as the “neck.”  
   – 1 yellow half‐cylinder perched on top of the neck.  
• You can think of the assembly as three main vertical layers:  
   – Layer 1 (bottom): The four orange cylinders (legs).  
   – Layer 2 (middle): The two yellow rectangular seat blocks.  
   – Layer 3 (top): A vertical orange cylinder (the neck) with a yellow half‐cylinder on top.  

2) Selecting Blocks from the Dictionary  
• Orange Cylinders (legs + neck):  
   – From the dictionary, block #7 is an orange cylinder oriented vertically.  
   – We will use block #7 five times total (4 legs + 1 neck).  
• Yellow Rectangular Prisms (seat):  
   – Block #1 in the dictionary is a short yellow rectangular prism lying flat.  
   – We need two of these side by side for the seat, so we use block #1 twice.  
• Yellow Half‐Cylinder (top piece):  
   – Block #10 is the yellow half‐cylinder oriented so it can “cap” a vertical cylinder from above without rotating it further.  
   – We use block #10 once.  

3) Assembly Order  
Below is a suggested bottom‐to‐top sequence:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 7   # front-left leg
  Step2: Move block with index 7   # front-right leg
  Step3: Move block with index 7   # back-left leg
  Step4: Move block with index 7   # back-right leg
  Step5: Move block with index 1   # left seat section
  Step6: Move block with index 1   # right seat section
  Step7: Move block with index 7   # vertical neck
  Step8: Move block with index 10  # half-cylinder cap
}
